member.name: IFileSystemImage3.get_CreateRedundantUdfMetadataFiles
member.summary: Retrieves a property value that specifies if the UDF Metadata will be redundant in the file system image.
member.param: Pointer to a value that specifies if the UDF metadata is redundant in the resultant file system image. A value of VARIANT_TRUE indicates that UDF metadata will be redundant; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage3.ProbeSpecificFileSystem
member.summary: Determines if a specific file system on the current media is appendable through the IMAPI.
member.param: The file system on the current media to probe.
A VARIANT_BOOL value specifying if the specified file system is appendable.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

member.name: IFileSystemImage3.put_CreateRedundantUdfMetadataFiles
member.summary: Sets the property that specifies if the UDF Metadata will be redundant in the file system image.
member.param: Specifies if the UDF metadata is redundant in the resultant file system image or not. A value of VARIANT_TRUE indicates that UDF metadata will be redundant; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Option changed, but the feature is not supported for the implemented file system revision, and the image will be created without this feature.

member.name: IFileSystemImage3
member.summary: Use this interface to set or check the metadata and metadata mirror files in a UDF file system (rev 2.50 and later) to determine redundancy.
